profileText: A Senator from California; born in Palo Alto, Santa Clara County, Calif., June 19, 1914; attended the public schools in Los Altos, Calif., Pomona College, and the University of Mexico; graduated, Stanford University 1936; International News Service, covering England, Germany, Italy, and Ethiopia 1937-1938; chief, foreign language division, Office of War Information 1940-1944; enlisted in the United States Army in 1944 and served until the conclusion of the Second World War; national president, United World Federalists 1949-1952; elected State comptroller of California in 1958, and reelected in 1962; business career in land investment and home construction; elected as a Democrat to the United States Senate in 1968 for the term commencing January 3, 1969; reelected in 1974, 1980, and again in 1986 and served from January 3, 1969 to January 3, 1993; was not a candidate for reelection in 1992; reprimanded by the Select Committee on Ethics for "improper conduct" on November 20, 1991; Democratic whip 1977-1991; chairman, Committee on Veterans' Affairs (Ninety-fifth, Ninety-sixth, One Hundredth through One Hundred Second Congresses); unsuccessful candidate for the Democratic nomination for President of the United States in 1984; was a resident of Los Altos, Calif., until his death on December 31, 2000; remains were cremated.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Cranston, Alan MacGregor. The Killing of the Peace. New York: Viking Press, 1945.
___, ed. Adolf Hitler's Own Book, Mein Kampf (My Battle). Greenwich, Conn.: Noram Publishing Co., 1939.
Fowle, Eleanor. Cranston, the Senator from California. 1980. New ed. Los Angles: Jeremy P. Tarcher, 1984.

U.S. Congress. Senate. Tributes to the Honorable Alan Cranston of California in the United States Senate Upon the Occasion of His Retirement from the Senate. 102d Cong., 2d sess., 1992. Washington: Government Printing Office, 1992.

researchRecord.name: In Institute for World Order records, 1948-1982.
In National Peace Action Coalition records, 1970-1973. On 10 microfilm reels and 6 tape recordings. Finding aid.

9 items (1939-1941) in correspondence with Theodore Dreiser; and correspondence relating to United World Federalists (1949-1958) and Dublin Conference committee (1945) in Lewis Mumford papers, 1905-1987.

In addition to the institutions listed above, items are also cataloged in collections at: State University of New York, Buffalo, NY; University of Virginia, Charlottesville, VA; and Yale University, New Haven, CT.
In Democratic Presidential Candidates debate records, 1984.
Correspondence in Louis Bruno Sohn papers, 1936-1973. Finding aid.

1914-1993. Ca. 740 feet. Pre-senatorial, senatorial, business, and personal papers. Includes journalism/writings, Common for American Unity files (1940-1941), Office of War Information (1942-1944), California Democratic Council (1953-1969), California State Comptroller files (1959-1967), correspondence, legislative files, speeches, press files, project files, campaign files, whip files/leadership, schedules, administrative assistant files, legislative files, press files, California project files, Senate Ethics Committee hearings, photographs, audiovisual materials, portraits, and memorabilia. Finding aid in progress. Permission of donor required until 2003.
Correspondence in Russell R. Miller papers, 1970-1972.
19 audiotapes (1970-1981) in Westinghouse Broadcasting Company collection, 1945-1981.

Discussed in Helen Linder Myers interview (1990), 247 pages; John A. FitzRandolph interview (1989), 260 pages; James R. Wrightson interview (1988), 260 pages; Lucien Haas interview (1989), 344 pages; Roy Ringer interview (1989), 172 pages; James R. Wrightson interview (1988), 260 pages. Also available at Claremont Graduate School; California State University, Fullerton; California State University, Sacramento; University of California, Berkeley; and University of California, Los Angeles.
1974-1977. Correspondence and briefing papers. Finding aid.
In Bruce Bliven papers, 1906-1985; Manuel Ruiz papers, 1931-1986; and Lorna D. Smith papers, 1930-1981 (bulk 1965-1975).
Correspondence in Frank Church papers, 1941-1984. Finding aid.
Correspondence in Another Mother for Peace (Association) records, 1964-1985 (bulk 1967-1977).
